level.text: All decisions shall be in writing and based solely on the record as prescribed in Rule 213.1.

With each decision finally disposing of an appeal or any part thereof, the Board shall file separate findings of fact and conclusions of law unless the findings of fact and conclusions of law appear therein.
A copy of the decision shall be transmitted by the Board to each party or his or her attorney.
Judicial Review of Board Decisions on Appeals.
A contractor may appeal the Board decision to the District of Columbia Court of Appeals within one hundred twenty (120) days after the date of receipt of the Board’s decision.

If the District determines that an appeal should be taken, the Director, with the prior approval of the Attorney General, may appeal the Board’s decision to the District of Columbia Court of Appeals within one hundred twenty (120) days after the date of the receipt of the Board’s decision.
